hypothesis: Input-layer weight variance predicts output-layer weight variance in high-order CPPNs
summary: Input-output weight variance shows NO correlation (r=0.028, p=0.53). No difference between high-order (r=0.027) and low-order (r=-0.016) CPPNs (q=0.042, p=0.64). However, output-layer variance alone correlates with order (r=0.203, p<0.0001, d=0.31) - high-order CPPNs have higher output weight variance. Weight groups are independent; the output layer effect aligns with RES-124 finding that gradient magnitude matters.
